data.title: This Week in San Antonio Spurs Basketball: Monday Bat Attack
data.meta_description: Another week of Spurs games, linked for you.
data.text:
Pounding The Rock: Game Preview #3: Sacramento Kings @ San Antonio Spurs - Scare Tactics

Halloween Night at PtR against the Kings, and Pop scares the crap out of us.

Pounding The Rock: Sacramento @ San Antonio Game Thread

Charts make the world go round.

PtR Quick Cap: Spurs Get Unsurprising 113-94 Victory Over Kings, The Legend of Manu Continues - Pounding The Rock

Spurs beat Kings. Get the details here.

Spurs vs Kings: Stat(s) of the Game: 4, 10 and 87.5 - Pounding The Rock

Theo rises.

Let's Play Some Defense: Kings-Spurs Recap and Analysis

Wayne's costume dominates the scene. And then there's a cool recap.

Sactown Royalty: Curse of the Suicidal Bat: Kings Chopped Down By Spurs 113-94

"After the death of The Bat, the Spurs outscored the Kings 84-68. You think that's some sort of coincidence?"

Project Spurs: Spurs vs. Kings Recap

Jeff García recaps the game.

MySA: Ginobili's swat steals the show

"Manu Ginobili's career has been marked with success. But perhaps his greatest achievement came when he slapped a flying bat out of midair." A mouse with wings indeed.

Project Spurs: Spurscast #175: Season Preview

Season preview podcast on the San Antonio Spurs. Fun as always, so if you want to listen to some Spurs fans doing a pretty nice podcast, click here.

Project Spurs: Preview 09: Sizing up the Western Conference

Where Jeff García refuses to be a homer. Shame on him.

Project Spurs: Preview 09: Spotlight on Richard Jefferson

David Thiessen puts RJ under the spotlight.

Project Spurs: Preview 09: Predictions

Some predictions from the Project Spurs fellows. (Michael De Leon picks the Lakers over the Spurs. I think we should applaud his honesty and then set him on fire the next time we see him...)

Project Spurs: A Real-World and Fantasy Look at the Spurs

For the fantasy enthusiasts out there.

MySA: Thanks to work on defense, Hairston sticking with Spurs

"With a roster filled with guaranteed contracts and a payroll already bulging well beyond the NBA's luxury tax threshold, there was only one way for a player with a non-guaranteed deal to secure a place on the Spurs' roster."

MySA: Spurs notebook: Popovich trims beard, lengthens practice time

"Spurs coach Gregg Popovich threw a couple of changes at his club Monday, starting practice at 4p.m. and showing up clean-shaven after sporting a full beard for more than a year."

MySA: The main Spurs are increasing

"The Spurs' first unit might not be the best in the division. The Spurs' second unit might be."

MySA: Pop tinkering with Spurs' chemistry

"The Spurs went into their first road game of the season Thursday with a plan that featured two-time MVP Tim Duncan in a more prominent scoring role than he had played in a season-opening victory."

MySA: Spurs strive for stability

"A new NBA season rekindles hopes that the San Antonio Spurs will make another championship run and that team officials have designed the right strategy to keep the Spurs financially sound in a still-shaky economy."

MySA: 10-year-old boy wows Spurs crowd on opening night

"As fans watched the San Antonio Spurs battle the New Orleans Hornets in Wednesday's season opening game, they also caught a glimpse of a dance battle on the AT&T Center court between a 10-year-old boy and the Spurs Coyote."

MySA: For Spurs, it's a two-man game

"Though the Spurs retooled often in the offseason, their hopes lie largely with the health status of veterans Tim Duncan and Manu Ginobili."

Opening night excitement has no age limit for Spurs

"They may be veterans of nine and 14 previous NBA seasons, but Richard Jefferson and Antonio McDyess say tonight's first regular season game with the Spurs has them as nervous and excited as when they were NBA rookies."

MySA: Spurs secure Hill for another season

Pop's reaction to extending Hill: "Yeah, that's a no-brainer," Popovich said. "If someone is your favorite player, you ought to extend him, whether he can play or not."

MySA: Spurs' Blair returns to scene of 'crime'

"It was in Chicago, at the NBA's predraft camp, that a physical examination of potential draftees revealed the absence of anterior cruciate ligaments in both of DeJuan Blair's knees."
